intro: Tridentea choanantha, commonly known as the slender trident leaf, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
